The Bible says, 'We are weak but He is strong.' ...

Defending himself on NBC's Meet the Press , Morris calls his conservative critics "ideologues" and explains "the basic inability of the ideological mind--such as George Will's or Bob Novak's--to comprehend that a great man can sometimes be comically fallible in private."
He continues: "I have no doubt whatsoever that Reagan was a great man and a great president, but some of his conversation in private was astonishingly banal."
On CBS's Face the Nation , Gore says he will keep Coelho.
Journalist Lou Cannon says the book actually "subtracts from our knowledge" of the former president.
Several pundits criticize George W. Bush for attacking the House Republicans' plan to balance the budget by fudging with the benefits schedule of the Earned Income Tax Credit.
Asked by Russert whether he believes in God, Ventura replies immediately that he does--although he belongs to no denomination.

He appears on three Sunday morning shows ( This Week , Meet the Press , and Fox News Sunday )--none of which interviews a supporter of art subsidies.
